info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain showers over Southwest Montana... Scattered thunderstorms across much of Southwest Montana south of Interstate 90 will continue to produce periods of heavy rainfall through this afternoon. One such storm near Grant, in Beaverhead County, produced in excess of one half inch of rainfall in about 45 minutes. Some storms may produce rainfall rates of up to one inch per hour. This rapid rainfall rate could cause at least some ponding on roadways, with minor flooding of poor drainage areas possible. If you are driving, and see water flowing over a roadway, make the safe decision, turn around, don`t drown. Occasional lightning, pea size hail, and wind gusts to 35 mph are also possible.
